com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget
Class WPToast

java.lang.Object
  Toast
      com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget.WPToast

public class WPToast
extends Toast

A modified interface with equivalent API to Android's Toast notifications that uses the app's default theme color to display a short message, the current time, and possibly an icon associated with said message. WPToast.makeText(Context, String, int) for standard Toasts, or WPToast.makeTextWithTime(Context, String, int) for making a Toast that displays the current time.

Version 1.01

  • If you pass a reference to an Activity where a Context should be the view hierarchy is traversed for the first occurence of a StatusBarView, whose background color and bottom position will be incorperated into the WPToast.
Version 1.02
  • Now broadcasting framework Intent.
Version 1.03
  • Added WPToast.OnToastVisibilityChanged.

Since:
06-03-2012

Method Detail

addOnToastVisibilityChanged

public static final void addOnToastVisibilityChanged(WPToast.OnToastVisibilityChanged mToastListener)
Add a listener to be notified when the visibility of a WPToast has changed. Set using WeakReferences so there is no need to unregister it.

clearOnToastVisibilityChanged

public static final void clearOnToastVisibilityChanged()
Removes all WPToast.OnToastVisibilityChanged.
Use with caution!

makeText

public static WPToast makeText(Context context,
                               int resourceId,
                               int duration)
Use #makeText(Context, String, duration, Drawable) to create a WPToast with an icon. Make a WPToast object with supplied parameters.

Parameters:
context - the current application context.
resourceId - the resource id corresponding to a string for the toast to display.
duration - the length for which the toast should display (WPToast.LENGTH_LONG or WPToast.LENGTH_SHORT).
Returns:
a reference to a WPToast object.

Use #makeText(Context, String, duration, Drawable) to create a WPToast with an icon. Make a WPToast object with supplied parameters.

Parameters:
context - the current application context.
text - the text for the toast to display.
duration - the length for which the toast should display (WPToast.LENGTH_LONG or WPToast.LENGTH_SHORT).

a reference to a WPToast object.

makeTextWithTime

public static WPToast makeTextWithTime(Context context,
                                       java.lang.String text,
                                       int duration)
See Also:
This method does the same thing with the exception that time will be displayed in the Toast.

makeTextWithTime

public static WPToast makeTextWithTime(Context context,
                                       java.lang.String text,
                                       int duration,
                                       Drawable icn)
WPToast.makeText(Context, String, int, Drawable). This method does the same thing with the exception that time will be displayed in the Toast.

setText

public WPToast setText(java.lang.String text,
                       int duration)
Sets the text of the WPToast. Sets the text of the WPToast, only for use if instantiated view constructor and now #makeText(Context, String, duration).

Parameters:
text - The text for the WPToast to display.
duration - The duration that the WPToast should last.
Returns:
A reference to a WPToast object.

setIcon

public void setIcon(Drawable icon)
Setter for this specific toast's icon.

Parameters:
icn - The icon to be displayed.

setUniversalIcon

public static void setUniversalIcon(Drawable icn)
Setter for universal, app-wide icon. This method sets the icon for all WPToasts henceforward unless otherwise explicitly supplied either via #makeText(Context, String, duration, Drawable) or setIcon(Drawable).

Parameters:
icn - Application-wide icon.

setDisplayTime

public void setDisplayTime(boolean on)
Set whether or not time should be displayed above the Toast message.

Parameters:
on - Whether or time time should be displayed.
